description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown thin by upto 20% to One Multi- stemmed Hornbeam (T1 on application) within Area 1 on TPO 400
decision_conditions: The Hornbeam is situated to the rear of 12 Copse Wood Way significantly contribute to the arboricultural amenity of the Copse Wood Estate Area of Special Local Character (ASLC) and has a moderate amenity value. Along with other nearby trees it provides a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings in the copse wood estate and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR). The benefit in amenity and biodiversity afforded by the tree is both present and future because it has the potential for a long life.

The reasons provided by the applicant to carry out the work is "to allow more light to garden adjacent" however there is no explanation as to why the level of light is currently unacceptable and no Arboricultural reason for the work. The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
